meanings.definition: Pursued by a pack of hounds in a hunt.
meanings.sent1: The scared rabbit was foxhunted by the barking dogs.
meanings.sent2: The fox was foxhunted through the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel pretended to be foxhunted by the playful puppies.
meanings.sent4: The elusive criminal felt like he was being foxhunted by the relentless police.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered through the trees as the prey was foxhunted by the predators.

meanings.definition: Engaged in the activity of hunting foxes.
meanings.sent1: The foxhunted hunters set out early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The experienced tracker led the foxhunted group through the wilderness.
meanings.sent3: The excited children played a game of foxhunted hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The skilled archer aimed at the foxhunted target with precision.
meanings.sent5: The forest echoed with the sounds of the foxhunted hunters on the trail.

meanings.definition: Participated in a traditional British sport involving the chasing of foxes on horseback.
meanings.sent1: The riders foxhunted across the vast countryside.
meanings.sent2: The participants eagerly awaited the start of the foxhunted event.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy knight nearly fell off his horse during the foxhunted race.
meanings.sent4: The elegant horses moved gracefully as they foxhunted through the fields.
meanings.sent5: The spectators cheered as the riders foxhunted towards the finish line.
